derivation: a primitive root; properly, to incline (the shoulder to a burden); but used only as denominative from H7926 (שְׁכֶם);
outline:
1. to rise or start early
    1. (Hiphil)
      1. to rise early, make an early start
      2. early (as adverb)
kjv_def: (arise, be up, get (oneself) up, rise up) early (betimes), morning.
strongs_def: literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning
